You can help cut mass incarceration in half. This tool shows you how.
Learn More

Dear ##SM_RULE_360 Email Salutation##,

While mass incarceration is a national problem, it must be dismantled at the state level. And Mississippi has a critical role to play.

Earlier this week, you saw the release of the Smart Justice 50-State Blueprints Project, a state-by-state analysis that shows how all of us, from community members to policymakers, can transform the criminal justice system and cut incarceration in half.

Well, here's what you need to know about the path to smart justice in Mississippi.

Did you know that in Mississippi the majority of people languishing in county jails have not yet been convicted of a crime and are awaiting trial? That's why we're working with a coalition to push for bail reform and prosecutorial accountability to put an end to wealth-based incarceration and practices that have focused on obtaining convictions at any cost.

We partnered with the Urban Institute and the ACLU Campaign for Smart Justice to provide a unique snapshot of Mississippi's incarcerated population, including an analysis of the state's drivers of mass incarceration, and why people there are imprisoned for so long. Most importantly, the Blueprint offers solutions tailored especially for Mississippi — solutions that will have a real, calculable impact on people's lives.

In order to end mass incarceration nationwide, every state — and every one of us — must join the movement to cut the prison population. That starts with comprehensive, cutting-edge analysis.

Check out Mississippi's blueprint to see how we can end mass incarceration.

Thanks for your support,

Jennifer Riley-Collins
Executive Director, ACLU of Mississippi
